name: spyke
tagline: A Python package for visualizing, navigating, and spike sorting neuronal extracellular waveform data
body:
![spyke logo](http://spyke.github.com/images/logo.png)

The latest is available in its own [GitHub repository](http://github.com/spyke/spyke). Documentation is currently very sparse. A thesis chapter that details the many steps involved will be available fairly soon, as will a publication detailing an alternative implementation.

Screenshots should be available soon.

For more details, see the [README](https://github.com/spyke/spyke#readme)

A much older version is available [here](http://swindale.ecc.ubc.ca/spyke) and is described in the paper [Python for large-scale electrophysiology](http://www.frontiersin.org/Neuroinformatics/10.3389/neuro.11.009.2008/abstract)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
